content.question: Which of the following statements best describes the use and resolution of the chordal seventh in measure 4, beats 2â€“3 ?

choices.label: The chordal seventh is in the soprano and resolves correctly in measure 5 by common tone.
The chordal seventh is in the alto and resolves correctly in measure 5 by downward stepwise motion.
The chordal seventh is in the tenor and resolves correctly in measure 5 by downward stepwise motion.
The chordal seventh is in the bass and does not resolve correctly.

content.answer: The chordal seventh is in the alto and resolves correctly in measure 5 by downward stepwise motion.

unit.text: 5: Harmony and Voice Leading II - Chord Progressions and Predominant Function

skill.text: Skill 2.E: Use symbols and terms to describe and apply harmonic, melodic, and rhythmic procedures of 18th-century voice leading (up to 4 voices) in notated music.
